contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God is trying to make me do something evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will bless this man as he obeys the law" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: this man will be blessed in his actions

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "who know that God will judge them by means of the law of freedom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who will be judged by means of the law of freedom

contextId.information: "actions and faith are what justify a person, and not only faith." James speaks of works as if it were an object to obtain. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: it is by works that a man is justified, and not only by faith

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "strong winds push them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

The word "itself" refers to the tongue. Also, here "hell" refers to the powers of evil or to the devil. This can be stated in active form. AT: "life because the devil uses it for evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: life. It is itself set on fire by hell

contextId.information: The phrase "every kind" is a general statement referring to all or many kinds of wild animals. This can be stated in active form. AT: "People have learned to control many kinds of wild animals, birds, reptiles, and sea creatures" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom God made in his likeness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who have been made in God's likeness

contextId.information: This can be stated in the active. AT: "Christ will not judge you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

contextId.quote: so that you may be healed
